reviews.text: A must see place and bring the whole family. I'm not a sports person that doesn't stopped me from being curious and visit this Louisville jewel. The sidewalk, the facade and of course the main attraction a 40 meters tall 9 meters diameter bat made of steel and carbon that dominates the whole block. A full scale of the bat requested by the one and only Babe Ruth!  Highly recommended in your visit to Louisville - Lexington metro area.

Awesome tour and experience! If you are a fan of baseball, you will definitely want to go and take a tour. There is a lot of great history to be found here. You can hold your favorite players bat as well as get a bat of your own. Highly recommend!

Learning about the specific methods used to creating a Louisville Slugger was very interesting. I really like the overall experience and the tour. The tour takes you through a series of sections that show you how bats are made. At the end of the tour you get to view some history and hold it. Like Babe Ruth's bat.

For being a total rookie when it comes to baseball this museum and factory actually have me a really good impression. The exhibits were well made and the gift shop had a great variety of cool things to buy. And the guided tour in the factory was really great, everything you didn't know about baseball bats - you'll learn right here. Greg, our guide, was ambitious and had a good knowledge. Over all, great experience!

A destination that all baseball fans need to experience! Do the tour, walk through the museum, and get something at the gift shop. There are a lot of neat things to interact with and some amazing pieces of baseball history from decades ago. Also, a cool tip is that you get a free mini bat when you do the factory tour!

I just turned 45 and the only thing I asked my Love for was, to do/try a bunch of stuff that I've never done before. So today he surprised me with a trip to the Evan Williams Bourbon Experience. EW is already one of my favorite Bourbons but I've never been on a tour before and I tried a few different kinds/flavors. Another reason to love it more. Oh and Tommy, our guide was fantastic! Great Birthday surprise.

I'm a bourbon newbie so I came in not knowing a lot but when I left I had a new appreciation for it. To the way it's made, the history behind it and the way it tastes! Everyone here was so friendly and ready for any questions! I enjoyed every part!

Evan Williams was our first bourbon tour. My boyfriend loves Evan Williams and we were in Louisville just running around and originally just went in for the gift shop but I’m so glad we done the tour. Our guide (pretty sure his name was Rob) was so knowledgeable and funny. I left my license in the car so I couldn’t do the tasting but my boyfriend did and really enjoyed it. The bourbon balls they bring out are incredible. We visited the gift shop and came home with coffee (that smells and tastes like bourbon) and a candle that’s amazing. We will definitely be doing more tours.

We came from Oregon with limited time in downtown Louisville. Best hour of the trip, such an amazing amount of information about Bourbon and Kentucky!! Our guide Micah was a hoot and made it an experience to remember!! Lots of fun to come home and share knowledge of how Bourbon oridinated, the requirements and even the explanation of why certain Bourbons cost as they do!!! Don't miss this if you have an hour in Louisville!! Just blocks from Louisville slugger and the muhamMuh Ali museums!!!!

The tour guide was very knowledgeable and kind.  It was a nice experience if you are downtown and want to understand the history and process.  I would recommend the main location if you want the true experience.  This was an historic site but it missed out on some of the beauty the distilleries have when you get into the countryside.  Very clean and welcoming environment.  Great if you want to hit up 3-4 distilleries in a short time on bourbon row.

This was a such a great experience!!! We had a private tour with an extremely knowledgeable guide. Everything was beautiful and the staff working were all friendly. We had a 60 person group for a company event and the dinner they offered us was so far past amazing!!! 

I did not upload any pictures of artifacts because everyone should make this place a “need to go” travel destination!!!

Worth going to for certain! You can tour the track area and pay a little extra and tour the stables! Museum was informative with a nice movie to watch and loved seeing all the hats on display! Nice gift shop also! Worth doing if you’re in Louisville!

Great tour of Churchill Downs and some good exhibits. The 360 movie about the Derby was really cool, but the brief tour of Churchill Downs was the best part. You really get a good tour of the high points of the track and race. Would definitely recommend doing it you are in the area.

We fell in love with this place! The history, the design, the friendliness, the information! This place will give you any information you want on the Kentucky Derby and if you weren't a fan of the Derby before, you will be after you visit! This was more of an experience than it was a museum. Wow, it will captivate your attention while remembering all of those famous horse races that you had watched and enjoyed.

Totally awesome!  Great tour with knowledgeable staff. The movie is a moving and thunderous 360 degree immersion. Watch it!  The museum itself shows all the history and the paddock tour is worth the extra coin if you love horses.

Amazing place, if you are in Louisville you must attend this historic place. Oaks and Derby week is a blast a must experience.  Derby brings people from all around the world with celebrities, athletes, and great people all around.  The in-field has some very wild people just having great times, millionaires row with amazing  dining.  Great liquor an food, betting on horses, parties, and much more.  Downs after dark is also another great time to go and enjoy. There are many more events that are amazing with many activities for adults and children.

Beautiful race track. We also went to the museum. They have a really nice gift shop on the track and another in the museum, def stop in at least one of them. The flowers around the paddock are just beautiful. Go on the tour, it's really nice. Giant screen that shows the entire race is really neat.

Came for a tour and sponsored dinner for a convention I was part of and had a great time.  The museum was very neat to go through and the tour was fun.  Very knowledgeable staff and they answered a lot of questions from the people we we were with.  The food was great and tried a mint julep too!  Recommend the tour if you're going to come and visit to get the full experience!

This place is really big. Bigger than I imagined. The other thing that was a surprise was the fact that it is in a residential area with homes directly across the street. It's also a stones throw from the Cardinals stadium. With that said it's a great place to visit, to see the museum, or place a off track bet. You will have to pay $3 to enter the track area, however you can pay to take a 30 minute tour. Overall, this is a great historic place to visit in Louisville even if you're only hitting the gift shop.

This place is legendary and the museum is awesome. It's nice to see an affordable museum that doesn't try to just take your money. There is so much history to learn and a walking tour is included in the admission. If you are in Louisville this is a must stop.
Always one of the most incredible events I've ever been to. The greatest fireworks and airshow combined.  Way to go Louisville.
Beautiful day for thunder over Louisville!
Very community oriented, well kept, nice place. Photo is wrong. Thats Ollies Trolley
Good times

Live love and laughingly enjoy the KY. Derby. It is my favorite time of the year in Louisville. ALL the visitors and the majestic thoroughbred horses, the atmosphere of expectation, the flowers, hats, Mint Juleps, & parties; everything about the Derby speak of spring and this town comes to life
Always one of the most incredible events I've ever been to. The greatest fireworks and airshow combined.  Way to go Louisville.
Beautiful day for thunder over Louisville!
Very community oriented, well kept, nice place. Photo is wrong. Thats Ollies Trolley
Good times

Always one of the most incredible events I've ever been to. The greatest fireworks and airshow combined.  Way to go Louisville.

Amazing place, if you are in Louisville you must attend this historic place. Oaks and Derby week is a blast a must experience.  Derby brings people from all around the world with celebrities, athletes, and great people all around.  The in-field has some very wild people just having great times, millionaires row with amazing  dining.  Great liquor an food, betting on horses, parties, and much more.  Downs after dark is also another great time to go and enjoy. There are many more events that are amazing with many activities for adults and children.

Beautiful race track. We also went to the museum. They have a really nice gift shop on the track and another in the museum, def stop in at least one of them. The flowers around the paddock are just beautiful. Go on the tour, it's really nice. Giant screen that shows the entire race is really neat.

Came for a tour and sponsored dinner for a convention I was part of and had a great time.  The museum was very neat to go through and the tour was fun.  Very knowledgeable staff and they answered a lot of questions from the people we we were with.  The food was great and tried a mint julep too!  Recommend the tour if you're going to come and visit to get the full experience!

This place is really big. Bigger than I imagined. The other thing that was a surprise was the fact that it is in a residential area with homes directly across the street. It's also a stones throw from the Cardinals stadium. With that said it's a great place to visit, to see the museum, or place a off track bet. You will have to pay $3 to enter the track area, however you can pay to take a 30 minute tour. Overall, this is a great historic place to visit in Louisville even if you're only hitting the gift shop.

A full scale of the bat requested by the one and only Babe Ruth!  Highly recommended in your visit to Louisville - Lexington metro area.

Learning about the specific methods used to creating a Louisville Slugger was very interesting. I really like the overall experience and the tour. The tour takes you through a series of sections that show you how bats are made. At the end of the tour you get to view some history and hold it. Like Babe Ruth's bat.

The exhibits were well made and the gift shop had a great variety of cool things to buy. And the guided tour in the factory was really great, everything you didn't know about baseball bats - you'll learn right here. Greg, our guide, was ambitious and had a good knowledge. Over all, great experience!

A destination that all baseball fans need to experience! Do the tour, walk through the museum, and get something at the gift shop. There are a lot of neat things to interact with and some amazing pieces of baseball history from decades ago. Also, a cool tip is that you get a free mini bat when you do the factory tour!

I went in for some pizza and left with 16 dollars worth of pastrey for the kids!!!!!!! This place is fantastic!!! From dinner to desert everything was amazing!! The best part was the friendly staff. The locals already know about Spinelli's but for anyone visiting Boston, this is a must experience!
Hands down has is the best cake in Boston! My parents got my Sweet 16 cake there, that was 8 years ago and to this day this is the only place we go for cakes
Loved it! 💖 had my sweet 15 there made my birthday dream came  true. The staff there are very nice and very good at helping out I love it!
Good Italian food when you do not want to make your own

I purchased their 3 leches cake and it was good but they didn't offer it in slices with the rest of their selection. The prices are decent and the service was superb. I will definitely be back to try their strawberry cheesecake and some of their hot food.

Burgers are very good. Lots of condimants to put on yourself. 
Only one complaint. They have two kinds of pickles and they are both wrong. They should have regular hamburger dill slices in addition to what they have . How hard would would that be??
Laid back atmosphere. Big fake tree in dining area. Nice dessert area. Great cookies. Made on sight, as are the rolls.

Top Burger Place! It is really tough to beat this place for burgers. Fresh made buns, awesome fries and top the burger off with any choice toppings. Absolutely awesome! Casual sit down family atmosphere.

Was an excellent visit today. Took my dad for his first time eating here. The sandwiches we got were fresh, hot and well flavored. Wait time was only about 5-10 min. I like mine with just cheese no bun with sone fries. My dad however loved the numerous extras you can self serve yourself to put on your sandwich. He was very happy with his selection and enjoyed the burger. I also enjoyed mine. Got a fresh cookie on the way out. The lady working that area was extremely friendly and seemed to really like her customers.

We had forgotten how delicious W.W. Cousins is! My husband and I went tonight and enjoyed a third-pound burger and a half pound burger with fries, onion rings, & green beans. The numerous toppings, which include a few unusual ones like green peppers and green olives, are delicious! Their service was also friendly and top-notch!
First time but it won't be the last! Great burger cooked to my spec's. Fresh toppings and a great variety. I didn't try the deserts, but I wanted to badly.  Loved this place!

This is one of my favourite places to eat! It is usually pretty quiet, but the food is great and the place is clean. The owner is a very sweet lady. As for what people are saying about service: when it's quiet, the grill workers tend to go back into the kitchen, and so when you want a refill you need to get their attention, but they're not rude about serving you. And the owner is almost always there and she's a great server.

All I really knew going in was that it was a Mongolian grill where you pick the sauces, meats, noodles, rice, etc that you want and then it gets cooked for you. I liked it. The staff were exceptionally friendly and this one woman even helped me put together a sauce combination. They had recommended sauce combinations on the wall and had descriptions below each one's name to tell you if it was sweet, tangy, sour, spicy, etc. I really liked that because at places like this I am always unsure what sauces to pick so I usually end up with something that is just teriyaki or just bbq. With the helpful guides I was able to put together an awesome bowl, and the cook was wonderful. It was a good experience that I look forward to repeating.
Great food. Good service. Nice owner. A must try.
We got into Louisville late, (9:30pm) and were surprised how fresh the selections were.  Great protein, as well as sauces.
The owner is so nice! The food is delicious, be sure to try things both on the menu and the bowls you can create yourself.
The best food served and the waitstaff and owner were very accommodating. We had a very pleasant experience. Will definitely go back. I highly recommend you visit. You will not be disappointed.

Second visit, best part of this restaurant is that there are a variety of cuisines on the menu. So far liked all of the entrees tried - Thai style noodles, falafel wrap, Egyptian platter and Cuban burrito. Quite convenient as it's open until late night (especially on the weekends). One things that appeals a lot to me is the dessert - plantain fries with whipped cream, heavenly (and a bit heavy! ;)) Friendly staff and multicultural interiors, would prefer it to be better lit, although not too dark. Overall, a satisfying meal go-to.
I usually get off work quite late. Always a great late night kitchen and menu. Wonderful serve staff. Never a bad time. Delicious!

Ate on Sunday for the brunch buffet. This was our first visit. I loved the stir fry and cheese tortellini. My mom and husband loved the brisket and chicken gorgonzala. The banana trifle, carrot cake, cheesecake, and chocolate cakes were all tasty as well. We definitely want to come back to order off the menu!
What a delightful place for brunch!  Our waitress, Jade (If I remember correctly😀) was delightful and helpful.  The brunch buffet was excellent.  The ambience was delightful...we will br back!

Eric is a great guy, it's right up the street, and everything I've eaten there is delicious.

May I add that I am a bit weary of reading about how sketchy and scary the neighborhood is. It's not. I've lived round the corner for nearly six years, and it's a cool neighborhood. If you're used to the scrubbed facades of the suburbs, this joint and this area may seem funky...Maybe because the buildings are over a hundred years old and have character.

Alas, now closed. This place will be missed.

Friends visiting here from Maryland we went to eat. Service is bad. Food is excellent.black bean burger is great,potato salad, too. We were not ask if we wanted refills or another drink. Comfortable atmosphere.  I will return.

Holy cow!... what a cool place!  Kudos to the exceptionally awesome hospitality and friendly service.  I experienced more friendliness in the first thirty seconds here than I have ever experienced in a collective weeks worth of dining.  On multiple visits now, the place has been nothing less than perfect.

Food:  Good BBQ grub.  The slices of sweet and spicy pickles that accompany many of the sandwiches are killer.... love them!  Overall, some sides taste "from the can" while others taste totally homemade (best collard greens I've ever tasted!).

I completely recommend this place.  And if you're lucky enough, your meal will come with a side of comedy (a/k/a the co-owner, Eric).

Was on the way back from a business trip and direly wanted to find a good BBQ place to eat. This restaurant was within the vicinity with excellent reviews so my group and I decided to give it a chance. Initially, we were a little hesitant because the neighborhood looked a little sketchy but boy are we glad we came here!! The best BBQ restaurant we have been to! I ordered a Brisket sandwich and it was cooked to perfection. The Mac and Cheese was okay but the baked beans and meat dishes were superb! I left with three bottles of their BBQ sauce to bring back home with me. Service was entertaining too. The owner was very humorous. Highly recommend this place!

Was a little leery given the surrounding neighborhood. However, don't let it bother you.  Great food. We had ribs, brisket and pulled pork. All were great. Spicy coleslaw was great too. Beer selection is outstanding. Friendly staff. Highly recommend.

Worst experience we ever had in dining. Went there several months ago for the first time to celebrate our daughter's milestone (21st) birthday. Server was very irritated cause we didn't order any drinks, appetizers or desserts! Owner/host was very rude too. When I asked if they have a complimentary dessert for birthday girl, he actually said a "candle"!  Our daughter didn't even want a dessert, she just wanted to share a picture on social media. We had a birthday cake at home.The drink menus were snatched out of our hands as well as the dessert menus. They need to realize that not everyone drinks alcohol!!! Management and staff need to be trained on etiquette and courtesy. We of course made up our daughter's birthday dinner the following week at Ruth's Chris! Le Relais needs to increase their portion size too. We left hungry on top of everything else. Ruth's Chris you leave full and always a fantastic experience! Only regret was trying a new restaurant on a special occasion.

Romantic and Cozy with Excellent Food - we had a birthday dinner out at Bistro Le Relais.  The service is personal and top notch. The menu offerings are very good - most will find something to their liking. The chef's specials were superb. The soufflé was "to die for." Highly recommended!

My wife and I went for an early dinner. It was great. The food was great. Awesome trout, fantastic 
pate, tasty salmon, and an out of this world bone-in chop. Dessert was so good I had two ! Service was top shelf. Topped off with a duo playing soothing jazz at a perfect volume. Thanks to all there. We'll be back.

As good as its been for some years. Great cocktails. All the right things on basic Bistro menu are present and excellent.  One small note: if more than one steak is ordered be careful to make sure the waiter serves the correct doneness to each person.
The lamb chops were tender and perfectly cooked. My significant other had the scallops and loved them. The service was great.

Great, authentic Italian food. Chef Josh Moore sources a lot of his produce with veggies from his own farm as well; you can't beat farm to table! The prices are also fair, and the portion sizes are generous. Great for a date night or a classy evening. A side note, Chef Moore is a big contributor to local charities and other Louisville events. I always enjoy patronizing a restaurant with high standards and community pride!

Delicious food! Wait staff is very interactive We usually meet friends to catch up and share their delicious appetizers and wine. But, I will NOT share my entree!! It’s ALWAYS delicious. Great place to eat!
Everything was perfect! Staff is very attentive and made sure we were well taken care of. Food was excellent  and the deserts were to die for!

This is the second time I've been here. I've had excellent meals both times. It seems they serve fish on Friday nights and I tried red snapper. It has it was served on rice with grapes and tomatoes and spinach. It was really good. My brother had is favorite meal there. I bought a flight of bourbon and enjoyed it immensely. They allowed us to try a very small sip of Maker's Mark 46 house created bourbon. It was exquisite. This place is not cheap and their bourbon is $18 a glass.  Our server was excellent.  The only negative was it my brother took home an entree of lasagna. We love lasagna, but unfortunately we hated this. Will never order this one again. It is also difficult to find a place to park here, but they do have valet parking. It is definitely worth trying. We will go back.

We recently celebrated our 5 year Anniversary here and it was amazing!!! The service, the ambience, and of course, the food was perfect. The manager Jonathan made sure to check on us, he was fabulous. I highly recommend this restaurant. If you have not been here you’re missing out! We can’t wait to go back!
Love this pub. Great music and reasonably priced drink. Brilliant atmosphere, especially at Christmas.
Nice old fashion pub, with good music and friends
Great Place for a Quiet pint, Lovely Guinness, Bartenders super Lovely and Nice
An amazing place to stay, the atmosphere and everything about this place is a definite place to go if traveling to Inverness, I would recommend this place first and foremost
Truly remarkable place that takes you back in time with a spectacular array of music.
